title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill now includes various training programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments for franchises. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable for such programs. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable. The fees for training, a monthly housing stipend, and a monthly stipend of $83 are provided for each month of training pursued. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable. A monthly housing stipend and a stipend of $83 for each month of training pursued are provided. The number of months of entitlement charged is based on the total amount of educational assistance paid divided by the full-time monthly institutional rate. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable. Payment of educational assistance for training cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement. The Secretary adjusts the amount payable based on the rate of educational assistance for different categories of individuals. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable. The Secretary adjusts the amount payable based on the rate of educational assistance for different categories of individuals, with a maximum of 12 months and $15,000 for a veteran under this subsection. Amendments include adding training programs described in section 3002(3)(C)(iii) of this title. The GI Bill now includes training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. The amendments allow for training programs described in section 3002(3)(C)(iii) of this title. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. This includes fees for training and a monthly housing stipend based on the basic allowance for housing under title 37 for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. This includes a monthly stipend of $83 for each month of training for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. This includes a monthly stipend of $83 for each month of training for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5, or a flat rate of $15,000 for other individuals entitled to educational assistance. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. The amounts payable under clause (i) are determined by multiplying the monthly amounts by the same percentage applicable to the individual's monthly amounts. A veteran may not receive more than 12 months or a total of $15,000 in educational assistance under this subsection. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with adjustments to the amount of educational assistance payable. Payment for training programs at specified establishments will be made upon certification of enrollment.
